CatDescriptText: Mrs. Arlen Cohen, housewife, East Liberty and Mr. Robert B. Pates, account executive, Plum Township, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 17, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "What's wrong with the Republican party in Allegheny County?" Mrs. Arlen Cohen's answer reads: "I don't feel that they are working for the common person.  They are more concerned about big business, it seems."  Mr. Robert B. Pates' answer reads: "I think that the situation in Pittsburgh concerning the steel strike has things held up.  In other words, the strike has a lot of ramifications in all phases of life regardless of whether it's economic, political, or what have you."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Arlen Cohen wearing coat with wide collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Robert B. Pates wearing trench coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
